intro: Helcia callichroma, commonly known as the red-veined orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features striking, showy flowers with deep red veins contrasting against a white or pale pink background. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its roots are adapted for absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Helcia callichroma is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and unique floral structure.
